name: Mississippi National River and Recreation Area State and Local Assistance
objective: The Mississippi National River and Recreation Area is rich with historical and cultural stories. This program provides assistance and/or funds to enhance partner organization planning for and interpretation of non-Federal publicly owned lands within the recreational area.
applicant_types: Local (includes State-designated Indian Tribes, excludes institutions of higher education and hospitals

results.description: No information available. One school district, one university and one non-profit received funding under this program.
One project was funded this fiscal year. Funding was provided to the State of Minnesota to undertake recreational projects along the Mississippi corridor.
The funds were used to promote the mission of the communities within the Mississippi Lower Delta region.
Four projects were funded with FY 2022 funds.

Accomplishments include development of the Rosemount East segment of the Mississippi River Trail in Rosemount, Minnesota to provide a full connection within the Mississippi National River and recreation area between south St. Paul and Hastings.

rules_regulations: 2 CFR, Part 200, 43 CFR, OMB Circulars, standard forms, and program information.
